section.name: LoggerAppenderFile
section.p: LoggerAppenderFile writes logging events to a file.

subsection.name: Layout
subsection.p: This appender requires a layout. If no layout is specified in configuration, LoggerLayoutSimple will be used by default.

tr.td: Path to the target file. Relative paths are resolved based on the working directory.
If set to true, the appender will append to the file, otherwise the file contents will be overwritten.

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: This example shows how to configure LoggerAppenderFile to write to file.log and to overwrite any content present in the file. The target file will be created in the current working directory.
It is also possible to specify an absolute path to the target file, such as /var/log/file.log or D:/logs/file.log

div.pre: <configuration xmlns="http://logging.apache.org/log4php/"> <appender name="default" class="LoggerAppenderFile"> <layout class="LoggerLayoutSimple" /> <param name="file" value="file.log" /> <param name="append" value="false" /> </appender> <root> <appender_ref ref="default" /> </root> </configuration>
